page.title: 08Road Transport.
page.content: The M4 motorway from London to S.Wales runs through our grid.A 30 minute traffic census showed 5 coaches,65 vans,1 motorcycle,9 tankers,132 lorries, 327 cars,4 caravans and 1 jeep travelling west,whilst travelling east there were 12 coaches, 14 tankers 53 vans,175 lorries, 870 cars and 4 jeeps.The busiest road other than a motorway is the A470 Cardiff-Merthyr road.A census showed that between 8-30 -9-30am an average of 1800 vehicles were travelling into the city centre. A survey of Radyr parents showed 59% travel to work by car,18% by train 7% by bicycle and 4% by bus. Families in Radyr owned 1-2 cars.63% owned a car less than 3 years old, 41% owned 1 car,52% two cars,7% three cars.No family in the survey were without a car.
